DOC.brief_summary: This pilot clinical trial study exercise diet intervention promote weight loss obese patient stage I endometrial cancer . Exercise diet may cause weight loss minimize risk gynecologic surgery related overweight patient endometrial cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Exercise Diet Intervention Promoting Weight Loss Obese Patients With Stage I Endometrial Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To determine participation 16-week exercise diet intervention would elicit weight loss , assess 10 % decrease fat mass , endometrial cancer ( EC ) patient . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . To determine participation 16-week exercise diet intervention would improve cardiorespiratory fitness ( CRF ) muscular strength . TERTIARY OBJECTIVES : I . To determine participation 16-week exercise diet intervention could improve quality life ( QOL ) , fatigue , depression . II . To determine effect 16-week exercise diet intervention cardiovascular ( CV ) health . OUTLINE : Patients undergo aerobic exercise thrice weekly 95 minute 16 week . Patients also undergo multi-lifestyle intervention base dietary approach stop hypertension ( DASH ) diet weekly 1 hour 16 week . After completion study , patient follow 16 week . After completion study , patient follow 16 week .
DOC.criteria: Clinical stage I EC Low grade disease positive estrogen progesterone receptor Body mass index ( BMI ) > = 30 kg/m^2 No history musculoskeletal , cardiorespiratory neurological disease preclude participation exercise Self ambulatory without use assistive walking device Is candidate immediate hysterectomy , follow evaluation physician , due desire preserve fertility , due degree obesity , due comorbidities , due patient refusal hysterectomy Must agree take progestin agent ( i.e. , oral agent MIRENA intrauterine device [ IUD ] accept treatment low grade uterine malignancy control disease intervention ongoing ) Note : potential participant WILL NOT ask delay surgery participate pilot study Patients metastatic disease BMI = < 29.9 kg/m^2 History musculoskeletal , cardiorespiratory neurological disease preclude participation exercise Is self ambulatory relies use assistive walking device Is candidate immediate hysterectomy , follow evaluation physician In judgement physician , candidate progestin agent
